author: Lewis Clarke
title: Film will highlight Britain's food production challenge - Devon Live
text:
Film will highlight Britain's food production challenge In Our Hands explores choices and challenges of British food production Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
‘In Our Hands’, exploring the choices and challenges we face in the future of food production in Britain is being shown in Tiverton.
The film will be screened at 7:30pm on Tuesday November 27 in the Old Heathcoat Community Centre in Tiverton. Admission is free.
The film follows a group of different farmers and food producers through 2016.
Aiming to bring back the worm to the soil, the ‘culture’ to agriculture and the flavour to vegetables, their stories show that the future of farming is still – literally – in our hands.
The film is made by the Landworkers Alliance, a grassroots organization representing farmers, growers and land based workers in UK. They believe that we can produce nutritious food for all whilst making sure that farmers earn a good living and look after the soil and biodiversity.
“This film is as inspiring and positive as it is down-to-earth” said Gill Westcott, Co-ordinator of Mid Devon Green Party.
“It’s also only an hour so we’ll be able to discuss how food growers and the countryside in Devon will be affected by Brexit and by new legislation.”
With the uncertainty over a Brexit deal, concern for food security, threats to bees and other pollinators, and the challenge of climate change, there will be plenty to talk about.
The film trailer can be seen at https://inourhands.film/
